TopicTitle: What Are Things You've Heard That Made You Facepalm?

Articles.Content: Look, Reddit and newspapers have the right to censor comments. IMO, Climate Change Denialists deserve about as much air-time/paper-space\* as Moon-landing conspiracy nuts, etc. There comes a time when the evidence becomes so blatantly obvious that there is no point in debating whether or not the problem exists, but debating what we should do about the problem. And no, one of the options is not: "Let God take care of it."

"If you rob people of their identity, if you rob them of their democracy, then all they're left with is nationalism and violence."

- Nigel Farage

Of course, in your opinion, "denialists" are worthless. I never expected to convince you otherwise. Actually, I don't expect to convince anyone here of anything. How could I? We're all so brilliant, aren't we? We play a game about *space.*
Not worthless, just misinformed, or willfully ignorant in some cases. Anyways, I apologize for temporarily derailing this thread.

Okay, this is an interesting conversation I had with a friend yesterday:

*Friend: Hey, you wanna hear a cool thing I heard on youtube the other day*

*Me: yeah, sure*

*Friend: Okay, so 2 trains are heading straight towards each other on the same train track. Train A is moving at 50 miles/hour and Train B is moving at 50 kilometers/hour. If we assume the two trains left the station at roughly the same time and are roughly the same size, what would the people on Train A be yelling?*

*a) All of the above*

![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) *OH NO!*

*c) LOOK OUT!*

*d) NOOOO!*

*Me: Uhh, C I suppose?*

*Friend: That is wrong. B,C and D are all incorrect*

*Me: Wait, but A says 'All of the above'. There's nothing above that.*

*Friend: Wrong again. Our options were:*

*h) 2 trainz!*

*g) What's a train?*

*f) I'm bored!*

*e) Uuuugh*

*a) All of the above*

![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) *OH NO!*

*c) LOOK OUT!*

*d) NOOOO!*

*Me: Wait, what?! those options weren't even there before! And why would they be saying that?*

*Friend: Well, the options below A might have been correct for Train B since they measure in kilometers and therefore their passengers live in a developed country like we do, But since Train A measures in miles that means most of their passengers are American. Hence why the answer is A.*

*Me: ..................................................................*
Sounds like a poor joke aimed at belittling Americans - certainly facepalmable.

Here is a rough copy of a conversation I had with an American on the old MSN.

me: "Hey, do you know New Zealand is the first nation on the planet to see the new dawn?"

him: "Really?

me: "yep, we are about 12 hours ahead of you, thanks to the time zones, therefore, I am in your future. I know things that have not happened for you yet!"

him: "For real? OK, then tell me something"...

by this time, I'm amazed he fell for it so I decide to make it worthwhile...

Me: "OK, in about 30 minutes in the USA, someone tried to shoot President Bush, two Secret Service agents are dead!"

silence.... for about 5 minutes....

him: "I told my parents, they are in shock, they've switched to FOX NEWS to wait for the news flash"

me: "You do know I'm joking, right?"

him: "what do you mean?"

by this time, I feel really sorry for him... and especially his parents...

me: "Nothing. I have to go now, bye..."

That was the last time he ever spoke to me.... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
